description: June 27th, 2013 The University of Toronto Graduate Students' Union sends its support to the Cooper Union Student Occupation.

related.description: A number of education trends made their mark in 2013, from massive open online courses to evaluating colleges based on their graduation rates. The underlying forces that drove change this year aren't likely to change anytime soon: declining public funding, changing demographics, advancing technology, and a tough job market.
related.title: 5 Higher-Education Trends for 2014

related.description: Apollo Tyres Ltd. (APTY) rose to its highest in at least 22 years in Mumbai trading after Cooper Tire & Rubber Co. (CTB) dropped a $2.5 billion merger plan, easing investor concern the Indian company would take on too much debt. Shares of Apollo climbed 5.8 percent to 107.20 rupees, the highest close since at least January 1991.
related.title: Apollo Tyres Climbs After Cooper Tire Drops Merger Plan

title: Support to the Cooper Union Occupation
content:
June 27th, 2013

The University of Toronto Graduate Students' Union sends its support to the Cooper Union Student Occupation.

Download (PDF, 198KB)

On Monday, June 24th 2013, the one hundred and fourty-four member General Council of the Union passed the following motion in support of the Cooper Union Student Occupation:

Whereas, the Union stands for public, accessible and ultimately free education, as expressed in our Policy on Education Fees; Whereas, Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art is an institution in the United States that exemplifies at least the last two of these qualities; Whereas, students of Cooper Union are currently occupying the office of President Jamshed Bharucha to defend its free and equitable platform of education; Whereas, international solidarity is of key importance to the growth and perseverance of the student movement; Whereas, the UTGSU should stake itself as a leader among the Canadian student movement and speak to issues relevant to its members and allies. BIRT the Union endorse and give its support to the student occupation of the Cooper Union. BIFRT the Union release a statement in solidarity with Cooper Union and expressing its view towards the future and costs of education. BIFRT the Union empower the Executive to research and act within their allotted abilities to aid Cooper Union in its struggle.

Website Design: Mike Thicke, 2011

entities.name: The University of Toronto Graduate Students ' Union
